message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.DS 

The paper proposes a novel early stopping criterion for gradient-based optimization, which is a common technique used in machine learning. The experiments conducted in the paper involve least-squares and logistic regression, as well as neural networks, which are all subfields of machine learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
